commands.name: az connectedvmware vm extension create
commands.summary: The operation to create the extension.
commands.syntax:
az connectedvmware vm extension create --location
                                       --name
                                       --resource-group
                                       --vm-name
                                       [--auto-upgrade-minor {false, true}]
                                       [--enable-auto-upgrade {false, true}]
                                       [--force-update-tag]
                                       [--no-wait]
                                       [--protected-settings]
                                       [--publisher]
                                       [--settings]
                                       [--tags]
                                       [--type]
                                       [--type-handler-version]
examples: az connectedvmware vm extension create --name "CustomScriptExtension" --location "eastus2euap" --type "CustomScriptExtension" --publisher "Microsoft.Compute" --settings "{\"commandToExecute\":\"powershell.exe -c \\\"Get-Process | Where-Object { $_.CPU -gt 10000 }\\\"\"}" --type-handler-version "1.10" --vm-name "vm name" --resource-group "myResourceGroup"

commands.name: az connectedvmware vm extension delete
commands.summary: The operation to delete the extension.
examples: az connectedvmware vm extension delete --name "vm extension name" --vm-name "vm name" --resource-group "myResourceGroup"

commands.name: az connectedvmware vm extension list
commands.summary: The operation to get all extensions of a non-Azure vm.
examples: az connectedvmware vm extension list --vm-name "vm name" --resource-group "myResourceGroup"

commands.name: az connectedvmware vm extension show
commands.summary: The operation to get the extension.
examples: az connectedvmware vm extension show --name "CustomScriptExtension" --vm-name "vm name" --resource-group "myResourceGroup"

commands.name: az connectedvmware vm extension update
commands.summary: The operation to update the extension.
commands.syntax:
az connectedvmware vm extension update --name
                                       --resource-group
                                       --vm-name
                                       [--auto-upgrade-minor {false, true}]
                                       [--enable-auto-upgrade {false, true}]
                                       [--force-update-tag]
                                       [--no-wait]
                                       [--protected-settings]
                                       [--publisher]
                                       [--settings]
                                       [--tags]
                                       [--type]
                                       [--type-handler-version]
examples: az connectedvmware vm extension update --name "CustomScriptExtension" --type "CustomScriptExtension" --publisher "Microsoft.Compute" --settings "{\"commandToExecute\":\"powershell.exe -c \\\"Get-Process | Where-Object { $_.CPU -lt 100 }\\\"\"}" --type-handler-version "1.10" --vm-name "vm name" --resource-group "myResourceGroup"
